question: 執行猶予
sourceMnemonic: Remember how you learned that <ja>猶予</ja> means "extension?" Well the jury has a <kanji>tenacious</kanji> grip on the idea of trying to let you <kanji>go</kanji> and they request an extension, so they give you a <vocabulary>suspended sentence</vocabulary> until they can figure out how to do it properly. You might be set free! E... eventually.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
